newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea reshuffles cabinet, keeps foreign minister.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea reshuffles cabinet, keeps foreign minister.

text.p: South Korean President Kim Young-sam on Tuesday carried out a cabinet reshuffle but kept most key ministers, including the foreign minister and the finance minister, a presidential aide said.
He gave no other details but Yonhap Television News said Kim replaced 11 ministers, including those for home affairs, justice, education and agriculture portfolios.

In the shakeout affecting half of the 22-member cabinet, Kim retained the ministers responsible for foreign and security policies ahead of crucial four-nation talks, involving the two Koreas, the United States and China, Yonhap said.
Senior officials from the four countries are due to meet in New York later on Tuesday to set an agenda and other procedural details for their peace talks.
The talks are aimed at hammering out a lasting peace on the Korean peninsula, the last Cold War flashpoint, to replace the fraying 1953 armistice that ended the three-year Korean War.
The finance and trade ministers remained unchanged to underscore the continuity of current economic policies, Yonhap said.
